pageProps.content:
![Gyeongsangbuk-do Arboretum (경상북도수목원)](/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609080_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > The Gyeongsangbuk-do Arboretum was founded in September 17, 2001. The arboretum exhibits local plants from Ulleungdo, an island off Korea’s eastern coast that is home to a special ecosystem that includes rare trees and wildflowers. The arboretum has total of 24 gardens, including the Alpine Botanical Garden, Ulleungdo Native Plant Garden and Needle-leaf Tree Garden. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|• 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
• For more info: +82-54-262-6100| |opendate:|September 17, 2001| |parking:|Available| |restdate:|New Year’s Day, the day of Seollal (Lunar New Year’s Day) & Chuseok (Korean Thanksgiving Day)| |usetime:|Summer Season (March-October) 10:00-17:00
Winter Season (November-February) 10:00-16:00

* Last admission 30 minutes before closing.| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Available Facilities:|Rock garden, Forest Culture Facility, Forest Experience Education Center, Children Forest Experience Garden (forest class), Botanical Garden (including Alpine Botanical Garden, Edible Plant Garden, Ulleungdo & Dokdo Island Native Plant Garden, Aquatic Plant Garden, St etc.), Forest Explanation Hall, Exhibition Hall, Needle-leaf Tree Garden, Broadleaf Tree Garden, etc.| |Admission Fees:|Free| |Parking Fees:|Free| ## Detail Image ![/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609084_image2_1.webp](/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609084_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609086_image2_1.webp](/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609086_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609089_image2_1.webp](/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609089_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609093_image2_1.webp](/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609093_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609095_image2_1.webp](/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609095_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609097_image2_1.webp](/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609097_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609114_image2_1.webp](/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609114_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609120_image2_1.webp](/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609120_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609122_image2_1.webp](/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609122_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609078_image2_1.webp](/2022-11-30-1669793770505/609078_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [☎️+82-54-262-6100](tel:+82542626100) - [🏠 arboretum.gb.go.kr ](http://arboretum.gb.go.kr) ```googleMap latitude: 36.2197511042 longitude: 129.2571250093 title: 647, Sumogwon-ro, Jukjang-myeon, Buk-gu, Pohang-si, Gyeongsangbuk-do ``` ## Directions From Daegu Dongbu Intercity Bus Terminal, take an intercity bus to Cheongha (청하).
From Cheongha Terminal, take a local bus bound for Sangok/Haok (상옥/하옥).
Get off at Gyeongsangbuk-do Arboretum (경상북도수목원).

* Intercity Bus Schedule: 04:30-19:24, 30-40min intervals
* Local Bus Schedule: 07:10, 11:30, 17:00

OR,
From Pohang Intercity Bus Terminal, take Bus 500 bound for Cheongha (청하).
From Cheongha, transfer to a local bus bound for Sangok/Haok (상옥/하옥).

data.title: Gyeongsangbuk-do Arboretum (경상북도수목원)
data.description: The Gyeongsangbuk-do Arboretum was founded in September 17, 2001. The arboretum exhibits local plants from Ulleungdo, an island off Korea’s eastern coast that is home to a special ecosystem that includes rare trees and wildflowers. The arboretum has total of 24 gardens, including the Alpine Botanical Garden, Ulleungdo Native Plant Garden and Needle-leaf Tree Garden.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Samsa Marine Park (삼사해상공원 (삼사해상산책로))
dataList.description:
Samsa Marine Park is located south of Gangguhang Port, overlooking the expansive East Sea. Thanks to its picturesque beauty and various facilities, the park is a favorite weekend picnic spot for families. Major facilities include Theme Land, Happy Land, a performance hall, bungalows, restaurants, and stores. There is even an artificial waterfall and a 20 ton-rock carved with floral patterns that add to the parks unique beauty.

Another must-see sight for visitors is Manghyangtap Pagoda, which was set up by those originally from North Korea. Every year on New Year’s Eve, a bell ringing ceremony takes place during the area’s sunrise festival.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Sajabawi Rock (사자바위)
dataList.description: The western coast of Ulleungdo Island is perfect for taking in the sunset; Sajabawi Rock in Namyang-ri is easily one of the most accessible places, located right next to the coastal road. The scenery is complete with squid drying in the the last rays of the sun at the coastal village, and boats heading heading out to catch more squid when the sun finally sets.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Rock-carved Standing Buddha in Icheon-dong, Andong (안동 이천동 마애여래입상)
dataList.description: Maaekseobulsang (Rock-carved Standing Buddha) in Icheon-dong, Andong is also referred to as Jebiwon Statue due to the small temple of the same name nearby. This statue is unique as the head and the body are not carved from the same rock. The head was carved from a different rock then placed over a large rock relief of the Buddhas body. This type of technique is frequently found in those built during the Goryeo dynasty. The distinct features and carving methods that can be observed from this particular statue are speculated to be from the 11th century. Although there is a small amount of damage on the back of the head, the statue is well-preserved overall.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Pohang Canal (포항운하)
dataList.description: Pohang Canal, completed in January 2014, cuts between Pohangs Songdo-dong and Jungdo 1-dong, connecting the waters under Dongbindaegyo Bridge with Hyeongsangang River to the south. The canal has a total length of 1.3km, adding on to the 8~10 km long seafaring road of Pohang. The canal is a restoration of an old water path, and the citizens have welcomed the eco-friendly construction as a community park. Many people enjoy walking along the canal or the romantic experience of riding on a cruise ship through the canal.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Pocheongyegok Valley (포천계곡)
dataList.description: Pocheongyegok Valley is a representative valley of Gayasan Mountain with clear water and a lush forest. The valley used to be a learning place for local scholars in the old days. Eungwa Lee Wonjo, a civil minister and a great scholar during the late Joseon period, spent the later years of his life at Mangwijeong Pavilion located along the upper steam near a small waterfall. The beautiful valley scenery stretches over 7 kilometers.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Palgongsan Provincial Park (Gatbawi Section) (팔공산도립공원(갓바위지구))
dataList.description: Located north of Gyeongsan, Palgongsan Mountain (altitude 1,192.3 meters) was called both Jungaksan and Buaksan Mountain during the Silla period. The mountain has many ancient temples and historical sites such as the Gatbawi Stone Buddha, Wonhyosa Temple, Cheonseongsa Temple and Bulgulsa Temple.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Nari Basin (나리분지)
dataList.description: Originally a caldera formed on the northern Seonginbong Peak, Nari Basin is the only flatland on Ulleungdo Island. The lava flow from the volcanic eruption created two other craters, which were turned into Nari Village in the northeast and Albong Village, now uninhabited, in the northwest. Records were found that the island was inhabited since the Usan-guk period, but the islanders had to move out of the island in the earlier Joseon period until a new settlement policy was enforced later on.
dataList.author: korea-tour
